148425632.review:
“I was there 3000 years ago…”

The above statement notwithstanding, I believe HuniePop is an interesting example of how society (insert Joker meme here) can influence individuals.  HuniePop was released in 2015, 8 years ago.  4 years prior to that, Twitch had its official launch.  For some reason HuniePop, was THE game played during 2015.  I, myself, bought the game back then purely based on what I saw on Twitch, considering my current taste in games potentially HuniePop was the starting domino that led me here… something to discuss with the psych ward psychologist.
There are a few points which I believe deserve special attention:

1.	The whole game is voice acted.  Considering most games within the same genre have little to any voice acting this does show a degree of quality that I think points it above the rest.

2.	The casting of characters.  Almost all the characters are from different cultural and/or religious backgrounds.  A part of me is curious as to whether this is purely for diversity or if it is a fetish-based thing?  With the benefit of hindsight, we know that the next installment, HuniePop 2: Double Date, would include a Arabic TSA Officer, which does skew my view for the later.

3.	You can pick your characters sex.  While this may be more common with more modern games that fact of the games age combined with the genre and the whole game being voice acted does make it worth mentioning.  An issue with this however is how vestigial it feels.  The fact that you can change your sex on a whim should indicate this.  It has no gameplay effect or story relevance, the only thing it changes is some pronoun usage changing and that’s it.

Having mentioned that gameplay above, what does one do in HuniePop. Well, the gameplay is a match-3 style of game with the match-3 game representing the individual dates that you are going on with the various NPC’s.  The gameplay loop of the game is gone on dates to earn favor and “munie” with which you can then purchase gifts and such to earn “hunie”.  “Hunie” is then used to upgrade your states to make the dates easier seeing as, as you progress through the game the dates get harder with each successful one completed.

This closed loop is rather well implemented, the only issue I personally have is that the end game is rather dull.  The final challenge the game can reward you with is “challenge mode” where the difficulty spikes even more, which is fine if that is what you want to test your skill on.  The problem being your actual in game skills have a cap, so the difficulty does feel that it reaches a point where you can no longer progress.

I do think HuniePop is worth your time.  It can be considered to be a part of gaming history in its own right.  The gameplay is fun, and the characters are enjoyable.  There is a reason why the poster child for the game, Kyu, is so recognizable even if you, yourself have never played the game before.

Pros:
•	Diverse set of interesting characters.
•	Good soundtrack.
•	Challenging gameplay.
Cons:
•	Menu navigation is tedious.
•	Challenge reaches its breaking point rather early.

                             [i][b] This review may contain spoilers [/b][/i]

[b] TLDR: [/b]

HuniePop is, at this point, a classic token matching game complemented by witty writing and and on the nose approach to humor.  Overall, a fun game in it’s own right without all the *cough* *cough* plot adding to it.  

[h1] [b] 8/10 [/b] [/h1]


[b] Plot: [/b]

The player takes on the role as a [strike] sexless virgin [/strike] normal guy that needs some help getting with women.  In the beginning you meet Kyu, a magical love fairy that wants to turn you into a “walking babe magnet”.  Kyu proceeds to teach you the ins and outs of HuniePop’s dating style and what each date may entail.  In order to progress through the game, players must take the various women in the game on dates matching tiles of 3 or more in a row.  Strategy is added by learning what each girl’s preferred tokens are when matching, giving the player the most possible points.  The player can also use the game's currency “Hunie” to purchase date gifts, increase stats, and personal gifts for each girl.  After a successful date, the player is rewarded with a picture of the women the date was with.  Each successful date raised the game difficulty, making the following dates more difficult to complete.  After 3 successful dates with a girl, the player will be able to take them on a date at night.  If successful, the girl will go home with the player for a bonus round followed by a sexy picture for your troubles.

[b] Pros: [/b]

[list]
    [*] Fantastic art style right in line with the classic dating simulator anime style
    [*] Fun and engaging gameplay that requires a moderate amount of effort and focus to complete
    [*] Witty writing that using a fantastic blend of sarcastic responses, sexual innuendos, and 4th wall breaks that will get a few chuckles out of the player from time to time
[/list]

[b] Cons: [/b]

[list]
    [*] The difficulty curve can be brutal at times
    [*] Not every character will be everyone’s cup of tea
    [*] Lack of direction at some points
[/list]

[b] Overall: [/b]

HuniePop is, at this point, a classic token matching game complemented by witty writing and and on the nose approach to humor.  Overall, a fun game in it’s own right without all the *cough* *cough* plot adding to it.

[h1] [b] 8/10 [/b] [/h1]

Este juego es buenazo pero sabes que otra cosa es tambien buenaza? Esta receta de ñoquis.

Ingredientes (salen unas 4 porciones de ñoquis)

1 kg de papa
300 gr de harina 0000
1 huevo
sal y pimienta

Receta de ñoquis de papa paso a paso

Lo primero que vamos a hacer lavar bien las papas ya que las vamos a hervir con cáscara. Esto es muy importante para que luego los ñoquis de papa no se desarmen, ya que al cocerlas con cáscara evitamos que absorban agua en exceso. Hacemos un corte horizontal por todo el contorno de la papa, en el video se ve bien, y las llevamos a una olla con agua. Cocinar hasta que al pincharlas se caigan.
Las retiramos y las dejamos enfriar sólo para no quemarnos. Con el corte que hicimos, la cáscara tiene que salir muy fácil en dos partes.
Pisamos las papas todavía en caliente como todo puré digno, agregamos sal, pimienta y mezclamos super bien. Agregamos el huevo batido y la harina. No le vamos a agregar toda la harina de una, nos vamos a guardar un poco para ver cómo viene. Las cantidades son más bien proporcionales, puede ser que la papa haya absorbido más agua o que el huevo sea más chico, así que vamos a agregar la harina de a poco.
Unir con la mano hasta que se pueda pasar hasta la mesada y terminar de integrar. Si en este paso ven que hace falta más harina, tenemos el resto para agregar. No es necesario amar mucho, la idea es llegar a una masa unida y uniforme sin tocarla mucho.
Cortar tiras de masa y hacer chorricitos o rollitos, y cortar trocitos de unos 2 o 3 cm de ancho, pueden enharinar el cuchillo para que sea más fácil.
Ahora viene la magia, vamos a pasarlos por la herramienta para darle forma a los ñoquis de papa de arriba hacia abajo. También pueden usar un tenedor enharinado que también les deja una forma similar. Colocarlos en una placa enharinada sin que se toquen para que no se pegoteen. Y claro, también pueden hacerlos sin la herramienta y simplemente que queden en su versión más rústica.
Para la cocción, llevar de a tandas a una olla con agua hirviendo con sal. Van a ver que se caen al fondo. Cuando suben, los dejan 1 minuto y ya están listos!
Son tan ricos los ñoquis que los puedo comer todo el mes!
Los pueden servir con una salsa o con queso!

142747000.review:
I am what many would consider a cock-loving homosexual. Ergo, many of my close friends were were initially confused when they saw me playing this game. It makes sense, none of these women do anything for me in the ways intended.

However, let me ask you this: Have you ever taken a human life? For most, I assume the answer is no. In fact, the very idea of it is absolutely revolting. And yet, you've likely spent hundreds, if not thousands, of hours doing just that in the context of a video game. Can the same not be done for dating women, even if I myself have only and likely will only ever date men? I think so.

Anyway, while the terms "dating sim" and "visual novel" are often used interchangeably within English-speaking audiences, I feel HuniePop is a prime example of how the former can exist without the latter. Much of the actual dialog is just surface-level smalltalk with the girls, with the occasional pep-talk/racist remark from your rizz fairy companion. If you're looking for a complex story, character development, worldbuilding, etc., you're in the wrong timezone, like how did you even think this was the place to find that?

The writing itself is fine, for the most part. Each girl definitely feels distinct enough to where you won't mix them up, at the very least, although I do admit I would have liked a bit more interactions between the girls. The aforementioned rizz fairy, Kyu, is who you'll end up getting to know the most, since she's the mascot/companion, which is somewhat unfortunate considering a lot of her dialog sounds like an edgy high schooler in the mid-2010s. It's not awful, but as someone who was an edgy high schooler in the 2010s, it takes me back to a time I'm more than happy to forget.

Speaking of, there's an undeniable dash of 2010s racist humor that, while not abhorrent or even seemingly coming from a place of hate, definitely caught me off guard. Stuff like Kyu referring to "yellow fever" and "chocolate" when you first encounter the Japanese and black girls, along with the Latina and Japanese girls's "unique gifts" being things like a sombrero and samurai helmet, respectively. (Word of advise: If you value your life and wellbeing, do NOT, under ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, give an athletic Latina you just met maracas). They're at least self-aware enough to have the Japanese girl acknowledge it, but yeah, definitely worth noting.

The gameplay is where it really gets interesting, though. The combination of Match-3 puzzles, time management, etc. is actually really engaging, and is why I actually saw this game through to the end. I'm just a sucker for these kinda games, I guess. While I personally found myself playing as an emotionless sociopath, purely seeking the optimal outcome of each encounter, I could definitely see how someone might be able to enjoy this game casually. While the endgame may be a bit of a slog and a grind, made even worse by the menus used to track things not being easily cycled through, I doubt many interested in this game are seeking 100%, so I guess it's a more personal complaint.

Overall, I enjoyed the game for what it was. I'm sure actually being attracted to the girls would elevate the experience, but it's not as critical as it seems.

Huniepop is one of the best match 3 games out there, not only that, but it's also a really fun dating sim. If you wanna succeed in this game though, you gotta take the advice of Bruce Lee: "Be like water".

"Be formless, shapeless, like water. Now you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup. You put water into a bottle, it becomes the bottle. You put it in the teapot, it becomes the teapot. Now water can flow or it can crash. Be water my friend."

This is the quote I think of when playing this game. You'll say one thing to one girl, jump to another girl and pick a totally different answer that contradicts what you just said. You basically become a yes-man (if you want to be the most optimal in the game). You can answer the girls however you want, but there's only one right answer to get hunie points, which are points you use to increase your stats.

From asking questions, to answering questions, from buying and giving gifts to being gifted gifts to gift to the ladies during the match 3, there's actually quite a lot of depth in this game. 

If you love match 3 games, or even dating sims and you're okay with some of the tamest sexual content I've ever seen in a video game (boobs, butt, vajay, no penetration), I highly recommend playing this game. There is SO much replayability because of how many different ways there are to play with all the gifts you're given. In fact, I just replayed Huniepop to finally unlock all the achievements. I had to start ALL over again because for some reason, my save data was gone, but I still had a blast replaying the whole game again.

With all that said, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game, and also, Beli is best girl.

In a vast sea of video games, where complex narratives and breathtaking graphics reign supreme, there exists a small gem that defies convention and ventures into uncharted territory. That gem is none other than HuniePop—a game that has shattered my preconceived notions and left an indelible mark on my soul. It is a title that intertwines profound philosophical questions with lighthearted gameplay, ultimately illuminating the transformative power of love and personal growth.

At first glance, HuniePop may seem like a mere dating simulator, but beneath its seemingly simple exterior lies a profound exploration of the human condition. As I embarked on my journey, I soon realized that this game was not just about superficial romance or shallow encounters. It delved into the essence of human connection, challenging me to reflect upon my own beliefs and understanding of love.

The characters in HuniePop are more than mere virtual avatars; they are vessels of profound wisdom and life lessons. Each interaction with these vibrant personalities provided me with an opportunity to introspect and contemplate the intricacies of human relationships. Whether it was the confidence-boosting conversations with Audrey or the enigmatic encounters with Kyu, I found myself immersed in philosophical ponderings about desire, authenticity, and the intricacies of attraction.

HuniePop weaves together gameplay and philosophical inquiry flawlessly. By combining tile-matching puzzles with dating mechanics, the game reflects the intricate dance between fate and free will. The puzzle aspect is not merely a distraction but rather a symbolic representation of life's challenges. It forces players to carefully strategize, fostering a sense of mindfulness and intentionality in their actions—an invaluable lesson that extends far beyond the digital realm.

Moreover, the artistry of HuniePop captivated me on multiple levels. The vibrant visuals and catchy soundtrack transported me into a world where colors were more vivid, melodies were more enchanting, and emotions were more palpable. It reminded me that life itself is an artwork in progress, and through every interaction and decision, we contribute to the masterpiece that is our existence.

But perhaps the most transformative aspect of HuniePop was its profound message of self-discovery and personal growth. As I guided my character through the myriad of experiences and emotions, I discovered facets of myself I had long neglected or overlooked. The game encouraged me to embrace vulnerability, face my insecurities head-on, and redefine my understanding of what it means to love and be loved. It became a catalyst for personal transformation, as I realized that true fulfillment lies not in external validation but in the journey of self-acceptance.

HuniePop is more than just a game; it is a philosophical gift that has reshaped my perspective on love, relationships, and personal growth. Through its thought-provoking gameplay, captivating visuals, and profound messages, it has taught me to approach life with a curious mind, an open heart, and an unwavering belief in the transformative power of human connection.

In a world where cynicism often eclipses hope, HuniePop serves as a testament to the potential for growth and enlightenment, reminding us that even in the most unexpected places, wisdom and profound revelations can be found. It has changed my life in ways I never anticipated, and for that, I am eternally grateful.

137337499.review:
OK, so this game is extremely horny, and also an extremely good puzzle game, and those two things go together really well.  There's a decent chance that you'll like it as an excellent twist on bejeweled mechanics, and its characters are fun and sometimes terrible and generally interesting to date.  The thing about the game is that while it is horny, it is also sleazy, steeped a little too long in pickup artist culture and alpha male bullshit where you collect people like they're cards and don't tell them you're sleeping with everyone you meet.  Everything is played as a joke, but not, like, a good joke - just the writing happily celebrating dancing too far over the line between fun and open sexuality and being an absolute dirtball.  

As sex positive games go, it's one of the pinnacles of the design and there need to be more like it.  It's fun and perfectly made and the horniness is a side bonus.  As actual narrative goes, expect cognitive dissonance between your personal identity and your characters identity, and to be occasionally if not frequently turned off by the dialogue - doubly so for the sequel.

I actually really liked this game.

I had never played any games like this (nudity or even puzzle games) but I enjoyed it a lot. The voice acting and polish is overall really clean. The jokes are actually funny and each girl was interesting and different. Of course there were times later in the game when dialogue would repeat itself or game play would feel a little repetitive but something was always switching up right around then to keep me interested and the game felt like a good length. THE BIG THING HERE IS THE PUZZLES ARE ACTUALLY REALLY FUN. Memes aside I found myself coming back to play the puzzles. The difficulty ramps up pretty quickly but the items allow for fun and varied strategies. Of course a review of this game would be incomplete if I didn't touch on the elephant in the room. The art is interesting...I am not sure what to say other than that. It is fun to reveal each one but nothing here is exactly revolutionary haha. If you like dating sim elements, booba, and great challenging puzzles then I think you will love Hunnie Pop. Even my girlfriend got hooked on this game so don't get any misconceptions that it's a female lovers game only. (There is even an option to select female pronouns). I am thinking about getting the second one but i'm not sure if I want to commit 20 more hours of my life to...art lol. 

P.s. The game is censored on steam by default so if you want full nudity you will need to look up a tutorial. Have fun.

136469488.review:
Fun match-3 game where you can move tokens across rows and columns, rather than swapping with ones touching it. Tokens have different traits, which give extra or minus points depending on the girl's preferences. You can combo 4 and 5 tokens together to create a "super token", which grants additional points. The passion bar acts as a score multiplier, giving you more points. You can also get tear shaped tokens, which act as item power. Overall, good simple mechanics and easy to play.

It obviously has adult content, okay "sounds", good quality visuals, and a small selection of outfits and hair styles. I wish there was more variety to choose from, maybe available in the form of mods. There are a lot of personalities (12 girls total), and interactions are fun. You will need to look up a guide to unlock the 3 secret girls. Bear in mind that you [i]don't[/i], and shouldn't, buy all the gifts for each girl (I did and it's a waste of time), as once you bed all of them you can directly buy the gift without waiting for it to spawn in the shop.

A popular match-3 game regarded by many, and I agree it's worth playing, even if you don't care for the adult content.

136418088.review:
It really does show the state of adult games that THIS was the thing every YouTuber went agog for in 2015. It also tracks that the Gamergate-flavored developer rose to success thanks to an army of fans and content creators who could look past such giant red flags as the fairy character dropping racist comments about both the Asian and Black characters within the first half-hour of gameplay. 

HuniePop is the epitome of the tired "bruh it's *just a sex game*, it's not that deep" defense that has been warped to the point we blew right past the tanks-as-girls dating sims into a full franchise of games about Hitler getting laid. It all traces back to HuniePop's stellar success. As well as encouraging the flood of half-assed match-three games on Steam. 

This game is written by a cis white man to the point it feels like parody. Anime chicks who say they weigh a buck twenty soaking wet are drawn to be pushing massive breasts out as far as possible and yet they have the gall to say they're D cups. Like, the writer has an understanding of women and bra sizes as influenced by comedy movies from the 90s where any boob bigger than a handful was called "a D cup" by similarly weird-cis-straight-dude writers. 

The horny content feels like a cis straight guy attempting to flirt with himself. The gameplay is alright. 

Sex games have evolved thanks to HuniePop's popularity, but as a result we have a wide plethora of much cooler games that take the exact same premise and expand on it with dialog written by people who can write sex. 

HuniePop is a cultural curiosity. A time capsule of a time when a bunch of anime sameface characters could go viral among content creators who wanted a lewd game they could easily censor. 

In 2023 this succeeds as a match-three game and fails at both the comedy and sex content it attempts to provide.

134640561.review:
HuniePop is a blend between a dating sim and a match-3 puzzle game, and it’s one of the best and most recognizable adult games available. The game is censored by default on Steam, but it’s easy to fix.
It simply does a lot of things right. All the girls are unique and enjoyable, although some are better than others. For the dating aspects, you can buy them gifts, food and drinks. You can also talk to them, to learn more info, or to be quizzed by them as well.
The dates themselves are represented by a surprisingly deep match-3 Bejeweled style game. It has a lot of strategy involved, like building up Passion to act as a multiplier, or Sentiment to allow you to use gifts. The gifts can do a lot of different things as well, and since you can only carry 6 of them, you have to choose your build.
Each date gets harder, but you can unlock upgrades, so the game has some light RPG elements as well. It also has some hidden girls to unlock, with 12 in total.
The music is good and memorable, and the art-style resembles a visual novel. Succeeding on dates rewards you with pictures, that get more revealing the farther in a relationship you get. You need to succeed 4 times with each girl for max affection, allowing you to spend the night with her, but that’s something you’ll have to find out for yourself… don’t worry, it’s well implemented.
To beat the game you need to win over all girls, so that’s a minimum of 48 dates. But the game has a lot of replay value. Getting 100% completion isn’t hard, but it’s time consuming. You’ll basically need to complete all the info for all girls. That includes finding out all the bio details, unlocking all outfits and giving them all gifts, which is the worst part. You also unlock Alpha Mode, where the match-3 game gets hard. It’s still doable, but only a few gift builds are viable. However, in this mode you unlock some convenience that makes it easier to get 100% completion. And to top it all off, there are some tough achievements as well, requiring you to play the game with certain restrictions.
Even without the adult elements, this is already a solid game, and you can see a lot of effort was put in here. It feels very polished and like a proper full game, which I think isn’t common for adult games. It’s a great game that I can easily recommend, even if you think you’re not going to like it. I was also skeptical at first, but it quickly won me over and I was very impressed with it by the end.

But what truly sets HuniePop apart is the depth of the characters and their unique personalities. Each character has their own distinct backstory, preferences, and quirks, making them feel like real people rather than just video game characters. The dialogue is witty, clever, and entertaining, adding another layer of enjoyment to the game.

The adult themes of the game are handled with taste and respect, adding a layer of maturity that makes the game feel more sophisticated and complex. The suggestive imagery and dialogue are not crude or offensive, but instead add to the overall charm and appeal of the game.

Overall, HuniePop is an exceptional game that should be played by anyone who loves a good puzzle game, dating simulators, or anime-style graphics. It's a game that is impossible not to get hooked on, with its engaging gameplay, charming characters, and fantastic storylines. It's a must-play game that deserves all the praise it receives.

Before I discovered Huniepop, I wasn't a fan of the "match 3" genre of games, but once I found it and started playing, I was completely okay with making it an exception. I love the strategy to matching all the tokens, and how almost every girl has their own different desired/least desired tokens, so you have to actually think about what you're matching. I also loved the humor. There were many times I audibly laughed at how funnily stupid some of the dialogue sounded ("Fu## these birds, am I right?" is my favorite) which was something I didn't expect coming into this game. Additionally, the voice acting was great, especially in the sex scenes. Each voice really fit each character, and their personalities were expressed very well. It was fun to meet all of the girls, see all of their outfits/hairstyles, see how they interacted with each other, and get to experience what their intimate side was like. This game will definitely keep you busy for hours.

I decided to 100% the game, and I had an enjoyable time for the most part! The only thing I got frustrated with was trying to get the Lucky Loser achievement, but this was before I realized I wasn't using the right items and used guides. I suggest looking at some for some of the more difficult achievements (for Pickup Legend, I used Malkavian's guide and it was a lifesaver) or if you're struggling because once I found the ones I needed I got the achievements SO much faster. I could've cut my playtime down by a significant amount if I had looked at some sooner, haha.

Overall, I highly recommend Huniepop, and I can't wait to 100% the next two games in the series! <3

Also, my favorite girls are Kyu and Beli~

What I thought would be a typical match three personal session with me, my computer, and a bottle of lotion looking at some fantastic art turned out to be one of the best buys I've ever made.  HuniepPop exceeds the mark at every turn and checks every box on the list of what could make a game like this great.  Not only is the gameplay very solid and intuitive, even for a match three game, it is actually fun and enjoyable.  This is because of many factors, such as the phenomenal soundtrack, the mesmerizing atmosphere beautifully portrayed by amazing artwork,  and the out of this world voice acting.  Everything about this game screams "instant classic" for the genre, and pound for pound is the absolute best in its genre.  The content that a lot of people are coming for (that good good artwork ~nudge nudge wink wink~) is also very well done and I'm certain will please if that's what you are looking for.  On top of everything, even if it is a bit silly as one would expect from a game like this, the story is very involved, each girl really has their own personality, and as characters you will feel like you are genuinely getting to know them.  I can not personally recommend this game enough, and if you are a match three spicy game champion, or are completely new to the scene, its hard not to fall in love with this game.  Do yourself a favor and try out Huniepop, and if you love it as I have try out the sequel, as it is equally fantastic.  

With Love,

129924728.review: HuniePop at its core is a connect-3 puzzle game (similar to Bejeweled) but with a lot of twists. Basically, you are trying to romance and date all the different girls and women you meet and they all have different personalities. And let's just say, the struggle and negotiation is represented by playing the puzzle game. So to win the date, you need to play the game. And of course, you have to memorize information about her. If you can't even remember her birthday (or her current job, or a dozen other bits of info), your chances of dating her will be quite slim. [h1]About the game.[/h1]

The trait and items used in puzzles are a permanent purchase and will not expire or run out of uses. The items you are buying for them outside of the puzzles will be gone on use.

Matching passion blocks will increase the passion level and make other blocks more powerful and will grant more points, Yellow blocks gives you moves and light blue gives you sentiment which i used for your items.
You can no longer date with that girl after having 5 hearts with her and you will be officially done with her and you can move onto a different one. So time to throw her in the garbage bin.

125255442.review:
This is a fabulous game.

It combines two simple, familiar elements but pulls off both impeccably.

I play the tile puzzle over and over. Such game addiction I have not known since Tetris. Refining the technique and in relation to the acquisition of all the "date gifts" was endless fun. You begin with only one gift so when you replay, you learn how best to use gifts you forgot were there.

But the real joy is the dating process itself. It's mostly just sort of automated; there isn't really much challenge in knowing what to say when because there isn't much consequence and even then you can eventually just remember what each girl wants you to say and when though it does feel a lot more than just another visual novel. Often their responses will really surprise you.

The girls by the way are superb. They are a rainbow of characters and types and everyone will fall in love with at least one of them with so many moments of dialogue that are by turns, delightful, funny, sexy and sometimes actually really poignant.

Every girl is on their own emotional journey and it pangs within me that we leave the game with them all in this place but then again, fanfiction can cure all of that.

Nikki was my girl. The nerdy gamer girl who has experienced too much antagonism to bother with people and who instead sees something of the world that everyone else misses (hint, hint).

Did I mention it's a little risque? I mean...woah...they're just still images with talking animation and yet...jsut woah.

Lots of outfits, lots of hair, locations, amazing soundtrack but you can easily play with your own music too. You can turn off the music and still have the dialogue with your own choice of soundtrack.

The achievements gave endless fun for replays and I am yet to do it flawlessly on hard. I recommend starting on medium because an aspect of the game is just locking you into hard mode.

You can even switch your own sex!

The breast is one of two prominences located on the upper ventral region of a primate's torso. Both females and males develop breasts from the same embryological tissues.

In females, it serves as the mammary gland, which produces and secretes milk to feed infants.[2] Subcutaneous fat covers and envelops a network of ducts that converge on the nipple, and these tissues give the breast its size and shape. At the ends of the ducts are lobules, or clusters of alveoli, where milk is produced and stored in response to hormonal signals.[3] During pregnancy, the breast responds to a complex interaction of hormones, including estrogens, progesterone, and prolactin, that mediate the completion of its development, namely lobuloalveolar maturation, in preparation of lactation and breastfeeding.

Humans are the only animals with permanent breasts. At puberty, estrogens, in conjunction with growth hormone, cause permanent breast growth in female humans. This happens only to a much lesser extent in other primates—breast development in other primates generally only occurs with pregnancy. Along with their major function in providing nutrition for infants, female breasts have social and sexual characteristics. Breasts have been featured in ancient and modern sculpture, art, and photography. They can figure prominently in the perception of a woman's body and sexual attractiveness. Overall, if you're an adult and you like match-3, porn, anime girls or a combo of those, it's definitely worth your time.

122520493.review:
Huniepop is a classic match 3 dating game, and absolutely the best of the Huniepot series. This game involves the player, who is approached by a "love fairy" named Kyu, learning how to score with the ladies in his hometown. If you manage to go on five successful dates (played out as candy-crush-match-3-style games) you earn the opportunity to take them back to your place for a night. The gameplay is enhanced by the date items, gifts you can give them to affect the board for the better, as well as the ability to upgrade your stats. Over time, the dates can become genuinely tricky so making these a priority becomes very valuable. You have the choice of talking to the girls before dates to learn more about their personalities, which is encouraged by providing you with extra Hunie to upgrade your stats with. I find this to be enjoyable especially on a first playthrough as there is a lot to learn about each girl and it creates a more realistic buildup to the final date. But if you aren't into that, there's an achievement for ignoring them! I find Huniepop to have the perfect balance for achievements. Some you'll get on a first playthough, some require specific but understandable rules to be followed, and only 1 or 2 require extremely careful planning. The graphics are cute, albeit the art style can be sort of off putting of you aren't super into it because it's a little amateur. I dont mind it though and some of the girls are pretty cute. Huniepop shines in the music department however. Tracks like Farmer's Market, Gold Falls Casino, Hiking Trail, and Lustie's Nightclub are very memorable and often get stuck in my head when replaying the game. 
Overall, I find Huniepop very enjoyable! It stands out amongst other H-games because of it's high skill ladder and fleshed out characters and environments. I highly suggest it for match 3 puzzle fans who dont mind the sexual jokes and lewd moments. Huniepop is "censored" by default meaning chest is shown but nothing below the waist. Definitely give it a shot!
